datafield.subfield: [al-Juzʼ al-khāmis min Irshād al-sārī li-sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 23
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper suggests 17th century.
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 56. Hadith (Traditions) of Kastallani."

Binding: Both upper and lower covers lost, though spine remains intact ; sewn in cream thread, two stations ; worked endbands in pink and lime green, intact ; overall in poor condition with covers lost, lifting and losses to spine leather, abrasion and staining of outermost leaves of textblock, etc. ; housed in box for protection.

Support: European laid paper with 8 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 22 mm. apart (vertical), and crown star crescent watermark with 'A D' countermark ; thick and well-burnished to glossy ; some staining.

Decoration: Section headings and text being commented upon (text of Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī) rubricated (pp.362-367 lack rubrics) ; letters of section headings of elongated ; textual dividers in the form of red discs.

Script: Naskh ; bold, clear likely Egyptian hand ; very slight effect of tilt to the left, occasionally more apparent ; mainly serifless though occasional right-sloping headserifs appear irregularly on free-standing alif, lām, etc. ; many open counters ; pointing in distinct dots, liberally spaced ; alif maqṣūrah pointed as yāʼ and often mardūdah ; descenders tending toward rectilinear ; rightward descenders tapered ; kāf mashkūlah (mashqūqah) preferred, with even final kāf bearing shaqq ; occasional free assimilation of some letters ; partially vocalized.
Layout: Written in 33 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: I (2), 7 V(72), 3 IV(96), 2 V(116), IV (124), 22 V(344), IV (352) ; chiefly quinions with a few scattered quaternions ; opening single bifolium blank ; catchwords present ; foliation in black ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (drops twenty pages following p.689 with p.670).
Explicit: "حدثنا ابو عوانة الوضاح عن ابن عبد الله اليشكري عن ابي بشر بكسر الموحدة وسكون المعجمة جعفر ابن ابي وحشية اياس اليشكري عن سعيد ابن جبير قال ان الذي"
Incipit: "ابن سعد من يشتري مني تمرا بجزر يوفيني الجزر ههنا واوفيه التمر بالمدينة"

Fine copy of an odd fifth volume of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī's exhaustive commentary on the Ṣaḥīḥ of al-Bukhārī, opening in Kitāb al-Maghāzī just before Bāb Ḥajj Abī Bakr bi-al-nās fī sanat tisʻ and ending abruptly in Kitāb Faḍāʼil al-Qurʼān, Bāb Taʻlīm al-ṣibyān al-Qurʼān.
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on opening leaf (p.1), "British Museum, London. No. 56. Hadith (Traditions) of Kastallani." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "73" in Western numerals on opening leaf (p.1) ; on blue-tinted paper once pasted on opening leaf and now at opening (p.5), a detailed waqf statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Adīb (Abdullah Edip), known as Jannatʹzādah (Cennet-zade), qāḍī of Erzurum, accompanied by his seal, reads: "وقفت وقفا صحيحا شرعيا على ان لا يخرج من بيت الكتب الملتصق بداري الا لعلماء سكنوا بارضروم بكفيل مرعى اورهن قوي وانا الفقير اليه عز شانه السيد عبد الله اديب الشهير بجنت زاده القاضي بمدينة ارضروم في سنة اثنى وستين ومائتين والف" ; occasional marginal corrections.
[الجزء الخامس من إرشاد الساري لشرح صحيح البخاري,
